ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC CALLRFC<options>;  
    CALL <FUNCTION> 'function-name'  <EXPORTING parameter-1|parameter-1.field-1=value-1 < ... parameter-n=value-n>> 
      <IMPORTING parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 < ... parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>> 
      <INTABLES table-parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 <... table-parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>> 
      <TABLES table-parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 <... table-parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>> 
      <CALLBACK <callback-parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 <... table-parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>>> </ default = SAS-library>;  
 
    DESCRIBE <FUNCTION> 'function-name' <SHORT>; 
  
The CALLRFC procedure executes Remote Function Calls (RFC) or RFC-compatible functions 
on an SAP System. 

Any Advanced Business Applications Programming (ABAP) function modules called by the CALLRFC procedure must be:

  o RFC enabled 
  o have no dialog boxes 
  o synchronous

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ABAPFM='abap-function-name] 
      
Specifies the name of the ABAP function module that SAS uses internally for 
metadata requests.

[Syntax: ABAPPROG='abap-program'] 
      
Specifies the name of the ABAP program that SAS uses

[Syntax: ASHOST='SAP-application-server-host'] 
      
Specifies the host name or IP address of a specific application server.

[Syntax: CLIENT=SAP-client-number] 
      
Specifies the SAP logon parameter for client.

[Syntax: DESTINATION='SAP-destination'] 
      
Specifies the destination in saprfc.ini if working with a saprfc.ini file for 
connecting to the SAP System.

[Syntax: GROUP='SAP-application-server-group] 
      
Specifies the name for the group of application servers when the SAP System is configured 
for load balancing.

[Syntax: GWHOST='SAP-gateway-host-name'] 
      
Specifies the host name of the SAP gateway

[Syntax: GWSERV='SAP-gateway-service'] 
      
Specifies the service of the SAP gateway.

[Syntax: HOST='RFC-server-host'] 
      
This option is supported in z/OS operating environments only. This option specifies 
the host name of the SAS RFC.

[Syntax: IEEE_REVERSE=flag] 
      
Specifies whether floating-point numbers are byte-reversed.

[Syntax: LANGUAGE= SAP-logon-language] 
      
Specifies the SAP logon parameter for language.

[Syntax: LIBREF=SAP-engine-libref] 
      
Specifies the libref for the library used to access the SAP System.
Specifies the mode for the SAP LIBNAME engine.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The SAP LIBNAME engine uses RFC calls to the SAP System.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A SAS RFC Server is used to communicate with the SAP System.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: MSHOST='SAP-message-server-host'] 
      
Specifies the host name of the Message Server when the SAP System is configured 
for load balancing.
Specifies the SAS data type for the ABAP type NUMC.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: 'N' SAS data type for the ABAP type NUMC. Ensures SAS 8 compatibility.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: 'C' SAS data type for the ABAP type NUMC.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: '$' SAS data type for the ABAP type NUMC.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PASSWORD='SAP-password'] 
      
Specifies the SAP logon parameter for password].

[Syntax: PASSWORDX='encrypted-SAP-password'] 
      
Specifies the SAP logon parameter for password in an encrypted form.

[Syntax: PORT='RFC-server-port'] 
      
This option is supported in z/OS operating environments only. This option specifies 
the port number of the SAS RFC Server that is used to connect to the SAP System.

[Syntax: R3NAME='SAP-system-name'] 
      
Specifies the name of the SAP R/3 system when the SAP System is configured for 
load balancing.

[Syntax: RFC_STRING='additional-RFC-options'] 
      
Specifies additional logon or connection parameters for the RfcOpenEx() call.

[Syntax: SAPLOGON_ID='SAP-logon-id] 
      
Specifies the string defined for SAPLOGON on 32-bit Windows.

[Syntax: SYSNR=SAP-system-number] 
      
Specifies the SAP R/3 system number. This option is used for SAP R/3 when it is not 
configured for load balancing.

[Syntax: TRACE='RFC-trace-flag'] 
      
Determines whether the SAP RFC library traces the RFC requests.

[Syntax: USER=SAP-userID] 
      
Specifies the SAP logon parameter for user.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: CALL <FUNCTION> 'function-name' 
  <EXPORTING parameter-1|parameter-1.field-1=value-1 < ... parameter-n=value-n>> 
  <IMPORTING parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 < ... parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>> 
  <INTABLES table-parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 <... table-parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>> 
  <TABLES table-parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 <... table-parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>> 
  <CALLBACK <callback-parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 <... table-parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>>> </ default = SAS-library;      
      
Call an RFC on the SAP System. The CALL FUNCTION statement can be called multiple times 
within a PROC CALLRFC step. The function calls are executed in sequence.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies fields or structures to be passed to the function module. The parameters 
parameter-1 through parameter-n are defined in the function interface as import 
parameters.

Specifies the fields or structures to be passed from the function module back to 
the SAS System. The parameters parameter-1 through parameter-n are defined in 
the function interface as export parameters.

Specifies the SAS data sets to be passed to the function module. The parameters 
table-parameter-1 through table-parameter-n are defined in the function interface 
as table parameters. SAS converts the SAS data sets into internal tables and passes 
it to the function module. The variable names in the SAS data set must match the 
field names of the internal table as defined for the function interface.

Specifies names for the SAS data sets to be created from the internal tables in 
the function module. The parameters table-parameter-1 through table-parameter-n 
are defined in the function interface as table parameters.

Specifies names for the SAS data sets to be created from the internal tables in 
the function module. The parameters are not defined in the function interface. 
The function module must implement a callback mechanism.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: DESCRIBE <FUNCTION> 'function-name' <SHORT
        
Reads metadata about an RFC and writes the information to the SAS log or to a SAS 
data set (using ODS). The DESCRIBE FUNCTION statement can be called multiple times 
within a PROC CALLRFC step.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that parameter metadata only is printed in the SAS log. The field metadata 
is not printed.
